meanings.definition: Having a large body or bulk; heavy or substantial in weight.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was much massier than the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The boulder was massier than the pebble.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant tried to lift the massier watermelon.
meanings.sent4: Her backpack felt massier with all the books inside.
meanings.sent5: The massier clouds signaled an incoming storm.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a large amount or quantity; abundant or plentiful.
meanings.sent1: The garden was massier with flowers in full bloom.
meanings.sent2: The treasure chest was massier with gold coins.
meanings.sent3: The buffet table looked even massier with all the desserts.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, making the air feel massier.
meanings.sent5: The massier trees provided ample shade on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To make or become more massive or bulky.
meanings.sent1: He decided to massier the sandcastle by adding more towers.
meanings.sent2: The chef massiered the stew by adding extra vegetables.
meanings.sent3: She tried to massier her hair by teasing it for more volume.
meanings.sent4: The construction workers massiered the building with additional floors.
meanings.sent5: The artist massiered the painting by layering thick brushstrokes.
